FuncDef:
The channel command creates a multicast channel and displays the channel view.
The undo channel command deletes all information about a specified multicast channel.
By default, no multicast channel is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a multicast channel name.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters. Digits, letters, and underscores (_) are supported, but spaces are not.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To create a multicast channel and display the channel view, run the channel command.
When a user requests for a multicast program of the channel, the device checks whether the program matches with an any-source or source-specific group specified in the bandwidth limit policy. If the remaining bandwidth is insufficient for the requested program, the device denies the request.
Prerequisites
The multicast bas-policy command has been run in the system view.
The policy policy-name command has been run in the multicast BAS policy view.
Configuration Impact
After the undo channel command is run, all configurations of the specified channel will be deleted.
Precautions
A channel name must be unique on a device. If a channel name conflicts with an existing one, the device displays an error message.A multicast bandwidth limit policy supports a maximum of 128 channels.A channel supports a maximum of 16 programs.This command is supported only on the admin VS.
